value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">For <del>a</del> the long poem is <del>lit up</del> luminous, <del>irradi</del> radiant.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>Yet</del> <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-espe" key="Spenser, Edmund">Spenser</rs> standing on the threshold of the great</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">room is half in shadow half in light. He is not <del>a</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>fully realised: <del>it</del> <add place="inline">He</add> is still anonymous, <del>He</del> in that he</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>does not <del>embody</del> <del>confine emotions to the</del> give</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">is still anonymous, in that he cannot confine</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">emotions within one place. He must symbolise;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">exteriorise: jealousy is not a passion to be spoken;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He cannot convey jealousy by <del>the speaking voice He must</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>make jealousy an</del> actual words from an actual</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">mouth. He must make jealousy abstract, a symbol.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He <del>ignores</del> <del>cannot</del> cannot speak 
            <choice>
              <sic>thro'</sic>
              <corr>through</corr>
            </choice> the mouth of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">individual. The single is <add place="below">still in shadow</add>. Yet, the other half of him is in the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">light He is aware of his [ancestors?] as <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gcha" key="Chaucer, Geoffrey">Chaucer</rs> was not, nor</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wlan" key="Langland, William">Langland</rs>, nor <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-tmal" key="Malory, Thomas">Malory</rs>. His is no longer a wandering voice,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">but the voice of a man 
            <choice>
              <sic>praitig</sic>
              <corr>practising</corr>
            </choice> an art, asking for</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">recognition,, <del>resenting his</del> & bitterly cautious of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>de</del> <del>his own</del> <del>that the world</del> of the world's scorn</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Had to the common voice, the voice of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">English commoner, the mummer, the maker, the man at the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">back door – Spenser had heard it–––</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>When <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-hlat">Latimer</rs></del></l>
